intro: Dammara orientalis var. pallens, commonly known as the pale dammara, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth, pale-green surface. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
